[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*]Nothing
[/list]

Overall Rating: 10/10

Does it live up to the hype? No, not in my opinion. I find that controls to be very awkward, I ran into quite a few game-breaking bugs where I would either be stuck room with no way out, stuck in the ground, and even loaded into what must have been a debug room. The game difficulty isn't great. Multiple points I would be loaded into an area with 3-5 enemies, at 13 health and would have to exploit the not-so-good AI in order to progress at all.

What I really like about half-life is that even though I know it is quite linear, it never felt like it, I felt like I was progressing instead of being guided in the right direction, heck one of the reasons I put this off was because the brief gameplay I did see lead me to believe my geographically-incapable head could not handle it.

Although I seem to be a bit unfair, this is just a warning not to think of this as the greatest of all time that it is paraded as, but a good FPS, and maybe my feelings on it are biased since I have already played the sequels, but that is a situation I'm sure a large sum of people will be in.

Also this game is always in the sales and is well worth the small amount you can get it for

Half Life is a revolutionary game. It revived its genre which was getting into a dull and monotonous state at the time with similar games getting released one after the other. It marks a gameplay experience with a cinematic style, getting you into the plot. What makes it so special and amazing is its narrative. The way it constructed a game world was so different from the FPS around at that time. You are not holding a gun from the very beginning, your only goal is not to kill as much enemies as you can in the search of an escape point. You have a facility and an alien world to explore, puzzles to solve and different enemies to handle in a strategic way. Also you have a mysterious man in a blue suit who seems to be appearing several times all of a sudden. G-Man is a bonus to the already definitive game. Yes, graphics feel dated, some combat and moving dynamics don't feel right but it is a game created in such a special way that you can truly play it after twenty years.

Half Life isn't just a game to play, it's a theatrical experience to be explored. An amazing storyline, gameplay that puts you into the eyes and mind of the character, and a taste of mystery you'll forever be wanting more of. A timeless classic I recommend to any gamer.

Having not played particularly many first person shooter games before, and having heard many excellent things about it, I thought it best to get round to playing it. I very much enjoyed the vast majority of the game, with only a few bits being unenjoyable (which were the bosses). The gameplay was fun, if not a little infuriating in places, but that might just be down to a lack of experience in the genre.
Overall, I very much enjoyed it and would recommend the game to people.

Half-Life es un juego shooter en primera persona en el cual controlamos a un cientifico que trabaja en los laboratorios de black mesa llamado Gordon Freeman el cual apenas lleva 1 semana trabajando alli. Half-Life nos situa con gordon cuando van a hacer un experimento con un cristal extraido de un mundo con presencia de vida alienigena llamado XEN, el tema es que al realizarse el experimento todo sale mal provocando una cascada de resonancias, asi que gordon tiene que salir de las instalaciones e ir a la superficie para que la H.E.C.U lo rescate pero en el camino se da cuenta que la H.E.C.U tiene otros planes, los cuales serian eliminar a todos los testigos y pruebas del accidente de black mesa. Pero queda una esperanza, la cual es ir a lambda core para entrar a XEN y matar a nihilant asi cerrar los portales de una ves, pero cuando todo parecia hiba a terminar de una ves, un hombre con corbata, traje azul denominado GMAN (Gobern Man) por sus archivos mdl, nos ofrece 2 cosas:

Trabajar para el.

Una batalla imposible de ganar.

Pero wow wow wow ya me fui del tema, esto parece mas un resumen que un analisis asi que vamos

/////PUNTOS POSITIVOS//////

1-Half-Life posee unos graficos que para la epoca eran muy realistas.

2-Buena historia

3-Buen dise√±o de mapas

4-Buena A.I (Inteligencia Artificial) para la epoca. (esto se nota en cosas como que los bullsquid tienen sentido del olfato.)

5-Los impactos de las balas no desaparecen y posee sangre estilo duke nukem 3d que le da un aspecto impresionante.

6-Esta totalmente traducido al castellano y con un doblaje bueno.

7-Posee una historia rica de argumentos.

8-Posee un soundtrack muy bueno que realmente afecta en la partida, no es lo mismo enfentarse a la H.E.C.U sin musica que con el precioso soundtrack, ya que se siente una gran adrenalina.

9-Posee una muy buena jugabilidad tanto haci que un ni√±o de 6 a√±os puede aprenderse los controles

10- El avanzado sonido para la epoca

11- La interaccion en tiempo real, es decir que puede contar la historia sin cinematicas. Osea mediante dialogos de los NPC (Non Playable Character) y otros elementos del escenario.

/////PUNTOS NEGATIVOS/////

1-No sacan el 3

2- Multiplayer monotomo

/////EXTRA/////

Posee 2 expansiones que serian:

Half-Life BlueShift: la cual nos pone en la piel de barney quien es un guardia de los laboratorios de black mesa (la peor expansion en mi opinion)

Half-Life Opposing Force: En esta expansion nos ponen en la piel de Adrian Shepard que es un soldado de la H.E.C.U un tanto especial.

Estas 2 expansiones ya mencionadas seran analizadas mas tarde.

            Y si tengo como 2000 horas o mas en el pirateado :V

Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Que dire de Half-Life que vous ne sachiez d√©j√† ? C'est probablement le FPS qui a r√©volutionn√© le genre : une histoire int√©ressante, un gameplay au top.

Bon, aujourd'hui, c'est assez moche. Mais √ßa reste tout √† fait jouable. Un gros b√©mol quand m√™me sur la derni√®re partie sur Xen, qui est moins int√©ressante.

[h1]Rejouabilit√©, achievements[/h1]

J'aurais plaisir √† y rejouer, mais tant qu'√† faire, je tenterai plut√¥t Black Mesa. Il n'y a pas d'achievements sur Half-Life.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Un classique, √† faire. Recommand√© !

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Je n'ai rencontr√© aucun probl√®me et le jeu tourne au poil sur ma machine.

Hardware : i5 3570K OC@4.5Ghz, Nvidia 670GTX, 16GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, configur√©s en screens X s√©par√©s.

Half-Life is an amazing game, maybe not quite as good as people have hyped it up to be but still something anyone who can play should play. Almost everything in this game is so exciting to play be it the combat the exploration or even, shockingly, the platforming (first game ive played with decent first person platforming). 
Here i'm just going to list what i liked and disliked.
Likes:
The world is vast and branching but not so much that you get lost, there are often 2-3 ways to get from point a to point b which means that even after playing a second time I never hit a part where I had to take the same path.

The combat feels good, enemies pop out of the environment during the straight shooting sections so you're not just aiming at a vague area, the aim assist was annoying at first but became a blessing later on when i had to hit small targets while moving fast. The guns make the most satisfying noises in the world.

The music is hype and only kicks in when it needs to, so it doesn't grate on you.

You never lose control. From the start of the game to the end you are always in control, this really helps immerse you since you never get pulled out to watch your character do his own thing in a cutscene.

The story is interesting but they never shove it down your throat, you can pay attention if you want and if not you can continue on your merry way.

Dislikes:

Ladders
Ladders
Ladders
Honestly i want to climb a fucking ladder wihout having a 50/50 chance of gordon deciding to fucking jump down 50 feet to his death

The final Boss: This is not a game killer by any means but it leaves a really bad taste in my mouth every time, you either spend 70 hours fighing him with every weapon in the game save one to barely win, or you use the ghostbusters beam and kill him in 2 seconds, so it's either spend a lot of time using things like the crossbow and revolver which have worked fine the entire game til now going through the annoying teleport move sections time and again, or you get lucky and in your mad dash to pick a weapon hit the ghostbusters weapon and insta melt him.

Tldr:good game, use the ghostbuster beam on the final boss.

I honestly like this better than the sequel. Even with the date graphics I find it extremely immersive, I love exploring the Black Mesa facility, crawling in vents, cursing whenever I see HECU grunts or those flying bastards, finding all the small details, just enjoing the atmosphere. Hell, call me crazy and call your local psychologist, I even find graphics to be beautiful, but probably it's just me being a weirdo (and no, not a nostalgia fag, I'm younger than this game). And if you are not weird like me, and if such visuals make you want to throw up, take a look at Black Mesa, a game that revamps the opening (not only, but it's the most visible change), makes graphics and MP5 better, as well as manages to make HECU grunts even worse.

So, this is an everlasting classic, probably one of the best games ever made, inspired many other games like Counter-Strike and lots of other FPS. Everyone should know about it, should play it and beat it, and once you beat it, you will love Gordon Freeman forever, love the Crowbar and even love Black Mesa and all of its aliens, especially the Vortigaunts, they are nice guys.

There shouldn't even have a review page for this game and there shouldn't have any negative reviews, it's impossible to unlike this masterpiece. All hail Valve, all hail Gaben.

20/10 - just buy it.

Enter the Black Mesa Research Facility, a giant science facility filled with aliens and OSHA violations. Weave your way through the winding underground chambers and overcome many of the obstacles within, through the use of a crowbar, many varieties of guns, some of which may/may not be entirely safe for the user, and those trip mines that nobody ever uses.

Defend yourself from aliens, mutant rotesserie chickens and extremely ballsy soldiers, either by using the environment, shooting them, or f**king up their faces.

Experience this through the eyes of Gordon Freeman, a mute theoretical physicist turned Rambo, who must escape the Black Mesa Research Facility after causing a Resonance Cascade, bringing aliens into the facility and mutating all the rotesserie chickens in the whole facility.

Ally with the remaining scientists and security guards who can help you escape, as long as they don't get killed by mutant rotesserie chickens.


I give Half-Life: Attack of the Mutant Rotesserie Chickens a 9/10.

Despite it taking the fps genre down a negative path, this is still a superb game through and through. Great levels with abundant set pieces and interesting scenarios with a good variety of weapons and enemies keep this game interesting throughout. There are some potentially frustrating elements, particularly towards the end, but those never really bothered me honestly. After all, why should an alien homeworld make conventional sense to humans?

Regardless, essential fps due to the impact on the industry -- even though that impact eventually lead to many uninteresting games.

5/5

How many times do I own this game now?

Half-Life is one of the most immersive games I've ever played. Even though you only get barebone instructions on what to do and you basically meet only random scientists, guards, and enemies, you truly feel like Gordon Freeman after smashing a few hundred headcrabs and blasting through the entirety of the Black Mesa facility.
I've been playing through on hard difficulty and while it is incredibly challenging you feel accomplished after making your way through each encounter, learning attack patterns of enemies and how to conserve ammo and health the best you can. I recommend playing on hard and saving often, because if there is anything negative about the game I can say, it is the autosave system. Very inconsistent, but everything else about the game is great and I definitely recommend it. Can't wait to play the expansions and the 2nd game.
I was not too big of a fan of this game but it didn't have anything too wrong with it. If there was a do not recommend but still recommend option I would pick that.
